name: arrayPop
description: Removes the last element from an array. This will cause an exception on an empty array.

params.name: array
params.description: The array whose last element is removed.

coldfusion.notes: The full function was added in ACF 2021, but the member function appears to work in ACF 2018 (likely using Java).

lucee.notes: Lucee allows a second, optional argument `defaultValue` of `any` type that allows you to enter a default value to return if the array is empty.

links.title: ArrayPop(), ArrayShift(), And ArraySliceSafe() In Lucee CFML 5.3.6.61
links.description: Blog post from Ben Nadel detailing new Array functions in Lucee.

examples.title: Remove the last value from an array
examples.description: This is the full function version of arrayPop to remove the last value of an array.

examples.title: Member function version.
examples.description: Using the member function. This version also works in ACF2018.
